image.altText: An animal believed to be a fur seal or sea lion.

props.synopsis: Wildlife authorities say a large marine animal found dead this morning after it was hit by a vehicle on a major Adelaide road was an Australian sea lion, and have described the incident as a "freak accident" — despite a warning from a passer-by the previous day.

title.children: Sea lion the size of a 'small cow' found dead on Adelaide motorway

image.altText: Two men standing in front of an old broken tractor.

props.synopsis: The Booleroo Steam and Traction Preservation Society is restoring a Fowler Road Locomotive believed to be the last of its kind in the world.

title.children: Unique tractor with 'absolutely magic' history set for a second life

image.altText: Peter dutton stands next to Nicolle Flint and Tony Pasin among other Liberal politicians

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has promised to pour more money into a freight bypass estimated to divert trucks from metropolitan Adelaide.

title.children: Coalition commits $840m to get trucks off major SA freeway

image.altText: A sign reading "Flinders Medical Centre - Main Entrance" with an arrow

props.synopsis: A document lodged with SA’s workplace safety regulator gives a glimpse into life on the frontline of an Adelaide emergency department. It isn’t pretty.

title.children: Is SA’s health system a hot mess? That depends on who you ask

image.altText: A life-like silhouette of a police officer

props.synopsis: A permanent memorial has been unveiled for fallen SA Police Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig, who has been remembered as a "kind, caring, generous and unique" country police officer.

title.children: 'An amazing legacy': Fallen SA police officer honoured with permanent memorial

image.altText: A blonde woman stands in front of a cityscape.

props.synopsis: Hannah Jayne graduated without an ATAR, then spent five years working at her local mine before she found her calling as a paramedic.

title.children: Young woman swaps high-vis for higher education to become paramedic

image.altText: smoke emits from a fire at a hardware store in tumby bay

props.synopsis: The CFS saved nearby properties from serious damage when a hardware store in Tumby Bay caught fire on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Fire razes Eyre Peninsula hardware store with estimated damage bill over $1m

image.altText: Dan Turner wears a black and yellow raincoat and smiles. His hair and face are wet.

props.synopsis: Dan Turner is ticking off a childhood "bucket list" dream as he races around the world in a boat he built during COVID lockdowns.

title.children: Man sailing around the world in boat he built in his driveway

image.altText: An Asian woman, a blonde woman, a man in security uniform, woman with a dog, a young blonde girl and a European woman.

props.synopsis: The families of those killed in the Bondi Junction stabbings have backed a coronial inquest, after father of a victim and prominent businessman John Singleton called for it to be shelved.

title.children: Families 'support' Bondi Junction stabbing inquest despite Singleton's criticism

image.altText: a huge ship docked in a harbour

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles repeatedly refuses to say if security agencies or the Trump administration recommended Darwin Port be returned to Australian ownership.

title.children: Defence minister won't say who pushed for Darwin Port backflip

image.altText: Peter Dutton standing behind Angus Taylor at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Coalition has walked away from its working from home policy and plans to sack public service employees while everyone on the campaign trail is wondering who leaked an announcement to Labor.

title.children: Dutton on the hunt for a leaker who torpedoed his port plans

image.altText: Aerial view of the outline of a submerged boat, with a small boat moving over it on the water's surface.

props.synopsis: A New Zealand military inquiry has found a lack of training and experience were among factors that led to the sinking of a navy vessel off the coast of Samoa.

title.children: 'Not really doing what I want it to do': 'Human errors' caused NZ Navy sinking

image.altText: Children play with toys at a preschool

props.synopsis: Some of the country's largest childcare operators are named in a damning cache of regulatory documents the NSW government and regulator tried to keep hidden from the public.

title.children: Childcare giants exposed in disturbing document dump

image.altText: A baby zombie rides a chicken in the new Minecraft movie

props.synopsis: As younger generations flock to short-form video content, traditional film and television producers are trying to get creative.

title.children: A Minecraft Movie's viral moment sheds light on shift in film industry

image.altText: Paul has dark hair and a beard and wears a blue jacket with white flowers on his lapel and a patterned bowtie

props.synopsis: The family of a Geelong father fatally stabbed while walking his dog in 2023 have come face-to-face with his killer during an emotional court hearing.

title.children: Father of three stabbed to death after car break-in, court hears

image.altText: A car with an infringement notice on its windscreen.

props.synopsis: Multiple people have reported recently receiving payment notices for alleged parking infringements dating back to 2022. A lawyer says you may not need to pay.

title.children: 'Hard to prove': Years-old private car park 'fines' sent to annoyed motorists

image.altText: Chart showing the percentage of postcodes with unaffordable rents for single parents, pensioners and average income renters

props.synopsis: An exclusive ABC analysis has revealed the nation's worst postcodes for renters, as well as the neighbourhoods hit with the biggest rent hikes since the pandemic.

title.children: Are you living in one of Australia's most unaffordable rental suburbs?

image.altText: NSW Deputy Police Commissioner David Hudson addressing the media in uniforms with media microphones in front of him

props.synopsis: The NSW Deputy Police Commissioner has told an inquiry he expressed his suspicions that an explosives-laden caravan was not a legitimate terrorism plot against a Sydney synagogue from the very beginning.

title.children: Senior NSW police officer suspected Dural caravan was 'manipulation of the justice system'

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: If you feel this is the most 'meh' election you've witnessed, you are not alone. New research shows Australian voters are not deeply polarised or highly enthusiastic; instead, they are both uncertain and ambivalent.

title.children: Australia is the anti-America when it comes to polarisation

image.altText: dredge barge pumping sand onto shore with beachgoers watching from sand

props.synopsis: Work is underway to replace the 4 million cubic metres of sand that washed away from the city's beaches during ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Sand pumping begins to restore Gold Coast's eroded beaches

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Two people are dead following a multi-vehicle collision at Nabiac, on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Two dead in Pacific Highway crash involving caravan and truck

image.altText: An aerial view of the township of Wadeye (Port Keats).

props.synopsis: Residents in Wadeye have accepted the NT government's promise to try improving healthcare services in the remote Aboriginal community, settling a long-running lawsuit over allegedly racist healthcare policies.

title.children: NT government settles with remote community over racist healthcare suit

image.altText: A woman poses for a selfie.

props.synopsis: Forensic testing has confirmed that human remains found in south-west Queensland belonged to missing mother Tayla Spies.

title.children: Missing mother confirmed dead after human remains discovered

image.altText: A picture of the Lady of Justice statue, standing outside of court.

props.synopsis: The now 18-year-old, who cannot be identified under Queensland's youth justice laws as he was 17 at time, was handed a 12-year sentence on Monday.

title.children: 'Heinous' suburban murder happened for 'no legitimate reason'

image.altText: Murat in a suit smiling with drumsticks in his hands standing between young musicians.

props.synopsis: Murat Dizdar is a proudly working-class son of Turkish migrants on a deeply personal mission to win back students from the private education system.

title.children: This former garbo now runs 2,216 schools and he's taking the fight to private education

image.altText: Donald Trump holds a large board listing countries and the percentage of tariffs the US will impose on their imports.

props.synopsis: Officials also outline why the US president decided to place tariffs on uninhabited islands, as investors wait for major Asian stock markets to open.

title.children: Trump officials say some tariffs could last 'days or weeks'

image.altText: An old smiling woman, wearing a colourful shirt and green cardigan

props.synopsis: Australian author Kerry Greenwood, who died following an illness, was best known for the Phryne Fisher detective series.

title.children: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries creator dies aged 70

image.altText: a male politician talking to a young woman on a podcast

props.synopsis: The Australian Electoral Commission has issued advice after the prime minister appeared in a co-authored Instagram post with social media personality Abbie Chatfield.

title.children: AEC advises politicians to authorise collaborative Instagram posts with influencers

image.altText: A team wears orange and stands in a huddle

props.synopsis: Super Netball in 2025 started with a bang, as 22,369 people set a new attendance record across the opening round. But there are still areas for improvement, and it seems the league hasn't learnt from the downfall of the Collingwood netball team.

title.children: As Super Netball continues to break crowd records, one club falls behind

image.altText: A woman in a burnt orange cardigan leaves her vegetable garden holding a bunch of green leaves

props.synopsis: What about the people who change their career not to scratch some creative or philanthropic itch or make a truckload of money, but out of necessity — because illness or injury derailed or destroyed their ability to work?

title.children: Sarah's 'career change' sounds like a dream, until you hear her full story

image.altText: Andrew Barr press conference

props.synopsis: The federal opposition's assurance it won't pursue forced redundancies to reduce the size of the public service is met with scepticism from its political opponents in the ACT.

title.children: 'I don't believe them': Barr criticises Coalition public service policy

image.altText: A row of subsurban homes with a battery charging icon in the background

props.synopsis: A top energy expert says governments must ensure households that can't access subsidies for batteries still get a benefit, and must not be penalised.

title.children: Parties urged not to repeat solar 'mistakes' with batteries

image.altText: Alice Springs bakery owners Neil Rilatt and Mel Darr

props.synopsis: Alice Springs bakery owners say they were down $14,000 last year after increases to freight and ingredients costs were compounded by staffing issues.

title.children: Outback bakers struggle to make a profit in face of rising costs

image.altText: A red brick building with gold letters reading Tamworth Police Station.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering a two-year-old boy in north-west NSW has been charged with domestic violence offences against a key witness in the case.

title.children: Man accused of murdering toddler charged with offences against key witness
